content: but is worth it after about 10 chains onto the wire stop and secure the yarn ends through the eye at the base but do not trim the excess yarn will be used to disguise the eye after securing the end you can now push the chains down the wire to hide the wire continue to work chains along the length of wire until you reach the other end eye cut off a long 15cm tail of yarn and feed the yarn ends firstly though the wire and then though the final chain and pull up the excess yarn can again be used to disguise the eye do not trim ends yet they will be used later for the snake plant the rest of the leaf is worked in 3 row built onto each side of the chain the actual stitch count is not given but rather the order of the stitches i find the best way to divide up the stitch types onto the spine is to use stitch markers to show the start of each section in each row take a look at the photo from my cordyline leaf below as an example of stitch marker placement up and down each side of the spine the idea is to get a natural layout of a leaf for a snake plant leaf the buried base is thinner and then broadens to emerge from the soil as wide the leaf then broadens out as it grows before tapering up to a point my version of the snake plant leaf is the variegated version with a darker yarn which i have worked in the first 2 row then a lighter outside in row 3 i stitched the leaf all the way to the base even though some of the leaf will be buried in felt and stones in the pot because you don t know exactly how much will be seen it s easier to make the complete leaf row 1 switch to a single strand of the same colour as the spine and to a 5mm hook chain yarn onto the bottom back loop of the spine chain and work a single_crochet into the same stitch work remaining stitches along the spine in the back half of the chain only in the following order single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet at the top chain of the spine add a chain and then continue down the other side of the leaf in reverse order for one of my leaves measuring 55cm in length i worked stitches as follows ch1 single_crochet in same stitch single_crochet into next 3 stitches half_double_crochet into next 5 stitches double_crochet until 15 stitches from leaf top half_double_crochet for 5 stitches single_crochet for 10 stitches ch1 and reverse down other side of leaf row2 ch1 add sm along length to divide stitch type sections work remaining stitches along row 1 in the following order single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet at the top chain work 3 double_crochet and then continue
